Rui Hou is a professor at Institute of Information Engineering, CAS. item.title: About
item.description: Dr. Rui Hou is a professor at Institute of Information Engineering, CAS. His major research interest includes CPU architecture and security, as well as data center server design. Before joined IIE, he was a processor of Institute of Computing Technology, Chinese Academy of Sciences. He published over 30 papers in international conferences and journals, and got more than 50 patents. Rui has also served more than ten times on conference organizing committees in international academia community.

item.title: Honors
item.description: Organizer, EDCS (Efficient Data Center System), 2012-2015, co-held with HPCA and ISCA Associate Editor, Journal of Parallel and Distributed Computing Program Co-Chair, Computing Frontier 2015 PC Member, HPCA 2019, HPCA 2018, PACT 2018, ISPASS 2019, Euro-par 2014 Publicity chair, Micro 2018 Web chair, HPCA 2011 Local Chair, PPoPP 2011

item.title: Experience
item.description: Researcher Ph.D.supervisor Institute of Information Engineering,CAS Leading for the Research Team of Processor Chip Security Architecture March 2017 - Present Researcher Ph.D.supervisor Institute of Computing Technology,CAS Director of CPU Laboratory, Advanced Computer System Research Center Developing Next Generation Data Center Server System and Core Chip National Natural Science Foundation, Academy of Sciences Strategic Pilot Project Huawei-Institute of Computing Strategic Cooperation March 2011 - March 2017 Vice President Suzhou Zhongshenghongxin IT Co.
